issue.title: Laser and stereo data misalignment (unrelated to diff between visual and collision geom)

content.raw: Might be related to [gazebo issue #503](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/503/), which suggests that laser ranges are measured from minimum range rather than the sensor origin.  That would produce scans that are too short.  In the case of the Hokuyo laser in the MultiSense-SL, each beam would be too short by 10cm.  If you substract 10cm from each beam, does the data look right?
